result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis George Piche was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary including but not limited to ADOA and domestic violence intervention program.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 3:08 PM Defendant Dennis George Piche in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Dennis George Piche.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters no contest plea to count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 and 3 dismissed and read in.  Court withhold sentence and places defendant on probation for 18 months.  Defendant to complete any assessment, treatment or counseling deemed necessary including but not limited to AODA and domestic violence intervention program.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  Clerk of Court collect costs.  Credit for 0 days.
